value: a little heart tart this morning because
I uploaded that video yesterday about
something that seems completely
ridiculous now in light of what happened
at not true damn and in the end it looks
like the cathedral came through
remarkably well from the fire that
started but I have to tell you when I
saw it yesterday
my heart broke my body went cold because
the pictures of it on fire were so
shocking and I didn't know anything
about it until later so it was pretty
much over by the time I found out and I
was I was I felt like a page had been
turned I felt like a line in the sand
had been crossed and I was very it was a
combination of angry and sad about what
had happened because it felt like it was
inevitable you see the course that
France is on and you see what Europe is
doing to itself committing suicide and I
don't know i I've been to Paris I went
in 2008 funny enough I was there for the
financial crash that was all over the
news
on our second or third day in Paris
that's all that was talked about on the
little hotel television the one channel
that we got in English which was CNN of
course the propaganda station now I know
that but as a visitor in France I
ignored that we ignored that and you
know what else
in 2008 the Pope Pope Benedict happened
to be there as well we didn't know that
before we booked our trip and it was
filled the city was filled with Zhang
Dharam first of all which really shocked
US military with guns everywhere
and nuns everywhere schoolchildren with
red baseball caps everywhere also which
was bizarre just way to see them just a
way to spot them I guess in the crowd
and it was full of Italians so notre dam
was so busy you couldn't get close to it
in the first couple of days but once we
did and we went inside and it's it's
majestic we spent quite a bit of time
actually on Ile de la Cite a where Notre
Dame is its beautiful part of Paris so I
watched the fire the spire it was evil
looking and then the pictures from above
where you could see the cross shape on
fire in the fading light of the evening
stunning
my first reaction though is gone
I don't know who did it I know there's
going to be speculation forever I've
seen that video of the person in the
cloak looking thing leaving all the
questions open they walked along that
balcony or catwalk on the church after
the fire was raging and who was it was
that someone in Islamic garb is it
someone in Catholic religious garb who
who was that I think what came over me
at first I felt this sense of loss like
the world I prepared my daughter for and
the legacy we all believed we were going
to leave our children and for those of
us who are older the world we thought we
were leaving behind is changing it felt
a little bit like going really high up
in a plane and looking down and seeing
the world burn and you have no idea
where you're going to be able to come
down and what its gonna look like when
you you finally do descend but you have
no choice but to keep participating in
whatever this new shape of reality is
going to be yeah so I was pretty I
wouldn't say I was fearful
I felt very final almost is that is that
a feeling I felt like something had
concluded and now we were on to the next
phase and it was angry and sad at the
loss but the church will be rebuilt it
will be if the people of Paris wanted
Chris wrote to me she is from France if
you saw my video a while back about the
juillet zone it was based on
correspondence between Chris and myself
we don't know each other but we
approached each other about working on
that juillet jean project together the
video I did so Chris wrote to me and I
haven't looked this morning for an
answer from her because I wanted to put
this
out before I saw the the perspective of
somebody else but she wrote to me and
she said she was going to withhold
comment and she told me that macaroon
was to have given a speech yesterday
about what he was going to do about the
juillet jones situation over there which
continues that speech was postponed
because of the fire she said she would
withhold judgment until she heard more I
couldn't sleep last night and I couldn't
understand why that feeling I'd had of
anger and sadness over the loss of the
Cathedral was gone I didn't feel it I
couldn't stir it in myself it was gone
and in its place was acceptance not of
defeat not of not resignation to the new
way of things but you know what I accept
I don't care who did that and I don't
even care that the old burned away I
care that it was God who did it it was
all of us all of us as fractals of God
who did that all of us our enemies did
not do that who who are our enemies our
enemies are in here each one of us is
our own enemy and we have let those
pieces of ourselves get too big
God did that and so I accept it and now
we have to figure out I have to figure
out don't put this on anyone else what's
the message it feels like the messages I
think the message is I Intuit that the
message is the these material things are
not the point blame is not the point the
past is not the point what we will build
is the point which part of ourselves are
we going to nurture are we going to give
in to the weakness in ourselves anymore
are we going to let those who tell us
lies continue to lie to us are we going
to go back to understanding our true
nature as virtuous beings granted by God
with rights and the senses common sense
love of humanity courage integrity
honesty valor creativity imagination
Brotherhood a desire to excel because
what we have done we have allowed
ourselves to be manipulated we have
embraced weakness under the auspices of
compassion as we've done and it's
weakened each of us and it's torn apart
the fabric it's put too much space
between each fractal of God it allows
the fire and the flames to come through
and wreck what we have thus far created
that's fine the past is over what'd it
feel like that fire gave us was a chance
to draw a line under this part of
history reignite in ourselves all of the
best of what our Christian heritage has
tried to give to us and that we have
been manipulated away from in our own
foolishness in our own weakness nobody
did this to us nobody did this to us
we accepted the Apple we took the bite
and this is what it is wrought and it's
up to us and we can do it draw a line
under it refuse to be mad about the loss
of some beams in a church understand
that God said the new era is here and be
strong don't be weak anymore go forward
embrace that part of yourself that
connects with God that part of yourself
that wept when they saw when it saw the
flames that part that part don't let it
be redirected into revenge don't let it
be redirected into dwelling on solving
the mystery of who did it and why it
doesn't matter what matters is who we
are going forward and that's what I'm
left with
a little bit dramatic but that's what I
really feel thanks for listening
everybody I'm gonna stop talking now
I hope you'll leave a thumbs up in a
